benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/payments - Retrieve account payments

covered: Valid Request: Multiple successful retrieval scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC05-TC07, TC21, TC22) validate expected 200 responses and payload shapes.
Empty Response: TC08 and TC09 validate behavior when no payments exist or account does not exist (empty JSON array).

Query Parameters: Many combinations covered — withAttempts, withPluginInfo, pluginProperty variations, audit values, unsupported params, malformed/partial pluginProperty, combined params (TC02-TC07, TC14, TC16-TC19, TC21).
Authorization: Authentication failure modes covered (missing token TC11, expired/invalid token TC12) returning 401.
Error Handling / Validation: Invalid accountId format (TC10) and invalid audit value (TC18) are tested for 4xx responses; injection/XSS input handling is addressed (TC19).
Service Unavailability & Integration: KillBill service down (TC13) and dependent plugin unavailable when requesting plugin info (TC23) are included.
Performance & Scalability: Large-volume response (TC15) and concurrent requests (TC24) are present to exercise performance characteristics.
State Variations: Partially populated payment objects and optional fields handled (TC25).
Regression / Backwards Compatibility: Explicit regression and backward-compat tests included (TC21, TC22).
Timeouts/Network Issues: Network timeout behavior considered (TC20).
gaps: Pagination: No scenarios exercise pagination (page size, offsets, continuation tokens) or verify behavior with very large datasets using paging — important for GET endpoints returning arrays.
Caching Behavior / Response Headers: No tests verify caching-related headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional GETs (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: Although concurrency and performance are covered, there are no explicit tests for rate limiting (429) when many requests exceed thresholds.
Authorization Depth: 403 / insufficient-permissions cases are not covered (only 401 authentication errors).
Schema/Content-Type Validation: Tests assert "Payment objects" and fields but do not explicitly validate full JSON schema, content-type header, or strict field types/formatting for each property.
Pagination + Performance combined: Large-data performance TC15 expects full array return; there is no test for behavior when the system enforces pagination instead of returning all items.

Boundary/Limit Cases for Query Parameters: There is a test for maximum pluginProperty count (TC16) but no explicit tests for maximum lengths of parameter values, or extremely long parameter lists/values to detect input-size limits (DoS protection).
Caching + Plugin Integration edge-cases: No tests for cache invalidation when plugin info availability changes, or stale pluginInfo returned due to caching.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: include scenarios for limit/offset/page parameters (or whatever the API uses), validate correct subsets are returned, total counts (if provided), and behavior when requesting beyond available pages.
Add caching tests: verify presence and correctness of ETag and Cache-Control headers, test conditional GETs (If-None-Match) resulting in 304, and behavior when resource changes.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to assert 429 responses and verify Retry-After headers and graceful degradation.
Expand authorization tests: add 403 tests for authenticated but unauthorized clients or scopes, and verify error payloads and status codes.
Add strict schema validation tests: validate response Content-Type, full JSON schema for Payment objects (types, required/optional fields), and behaviour when optional fields are absent.

Add boundary/input-size tests: test maximum lengths and counts for pluginProperty and other query params, very long values, and ensure the service responds predictably (400/422 or truncation) and resists DoS attempts.
Adjust large-data tests for pagination: replace or complement TC15 with paging-based validation rather than expecting a single massive payload; include performance assertions per page.

Add caching + integration edge-case tests: verify pluginInfo is null/unavailable when plugin down (already present) and ensure caching does not incorrectly surface stale plugin data after plugin state changes.
